attributes.additional_details: The law and practice relating to  licences for  animal procedures should, subject to anonymity for experimenters and the protection of intellectual property rights, be based on the  principle of participation. There should be (1) full  publication of all results, whether positive or negative, of, and all data recorded on, such procedures at least in electronic form; (2) full public electronic consultation before  authorisation  about the purpose, procedures, monitoring, degree of suffering and living conditions of the animals; (3) permanent  public availability of all licences,  and reports by ASPA inspectors.
